segments.text: I glance at the garden outside, so tidy and calm; it feels like a world away.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Inside this kitchen, the chaos is palpable, yet there’s an undercurrent of innocence.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I see the boy reaching for those cookies; it’s both adorable and terrifying.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: How can the woman not notice the water spilling everywhere?
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The water’s steady flow seems almost mocking in contrast to the children’s excitement.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I feel a knot of fear in my stomach; that stool could tip at any moment.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: It’s strange how one moment can be filled with such joy and potential disaster.
segments.speaker: PAR
